step_1.description: Disease mechanism defined: Parkin's E3 ligase function is critical for ubiquitination. Mutations disrupt this, leading to Parkinson's disease.

step_2.description: Assay applicability: Urea unfolding experiments and NMR spectroscopy directly assess structural stability, which is central to the disease mechanism.

step_3a.description: Controls and replicates: Wild-type ubiquitin and parkin Ubld were used as controls. NMR experiments imply replication.

step_3c.description: Variant controls: No explicit use of known pathogenic/benign variants as controls in the abstract.

step_4a.description: Statistical analyses: No explicit OddsPath, p-values, or confidence intervals reported in the abstract.

step_4b.description: Control count: 2 variants (K48A and R42P) studied, with no additional controls specified.

variants.overall_conclusion: K48A shows minimal structural impact but disrupts protein-protein interactions. The lack of statistical analysis and limited controls (n=2) result in PS3_supporting evidence.

step_1.description: Disease mechanism defined: Parkin's E3 ligase function is critical for ubiquitination. Mutations disrupt this, leading to Parkinson's disease.

step_2.description: Assay applicability: Urea unfolding experiments and NMR spectroscopy directly assess structural stability, which is central to the disease mechanism.

step_3a.description: Controls and replicates: Wild-type ubiquitin and parkin Ubld were used as controls. NMR experiments imply replication.

step_3c.description: Variant controls: No explicit use of known pathogenic/benign variants as controls in the abstract.

step_4a.description: Statistical analyses: No explicit OddsPath, p-values, or confidence intervals reported in the abstract.

step_4b.description: Control count: 2 variants (K48A and R42P) studied, with no additional controls specified.

variants.overall_conclusion: R42P causes complete structural unfolding, a severe functional defect. However, the lack of statistical analysis and limited controls (n=2) result in PS3_supporting evidence.
